When active, Last-Ditch Effort provides 15 AP each of the following:

- Ink Saver (Main)

- Ink Saver (Sub)

- Ink Recovery Up

- Quick Respawn

Last-Ditch Effort is active when any of the following conditions are met:

- The time remaining on the timer is 30 seconds or less (overtime included).

- The opponent team's counter is 30 or less.

Last-Ditch Effort is the primary ability of:

- ▲ In Ranked Battle, Last-Ditch Effort will activate when the opposing team's counter reaches 30, and remain active until the end of battle.

- ▲ In Ranked Battle, Last-Ditch Effort can now be activated during overtime.

- ▲ While active, Last-Ditch Effort will now also shorten the amount of time players take to respawn after being splatted.

Last-Ditch Effort returns in Splatoon 2 with increased benefits and a tweaked means of activation:

Under specific conditions, Last-Ditch Effort now grants its user 1 to 24 ability points each of the following abilities:[1][2]

- Ink Saver (Main)

- Ink Saver (Sub)

- Ink Recovery Up

These abilities only begin to take effect under either of the following conditions:

- There are at most 30 seconds remaining on the game clock, or Overtime has begun in a Ranked Battle, at which the maximum 24 ability points will be granted for each of the above abilities.

- In a Ranked Battle, the opposing team's countdown has at most 50 points remaining. The effects of Last-Ditch Effort increase as the opposing team's countdown decreases from 50 to 30 points remaining, starting with 1 ability point for each ability and maxing out to 24 ability points:

This ability is most beneficial to players whose weapon sets include a reliable lethal bomb (such as a Splat Bomb, Suction Bomb, or a Fizzy Bomb), but players whose main weapons have low ink efficiency (such as the Foil Squeezer) can also benefit as well.

Last-Ditch Effort is the primary ability of:

- ▲ Ink Saver (Main), Ink Saver (Sub), and Ink Recovery Up provided by this ability was increased to 18 AP (from 15 AP).

- ▼ No longer provides Quick Respawn.

- ▲ During its active period, the effect of Last-Ditch Effort is now multiplied by 2.4 times the number of times it is equipped as a main gear ability (was previously multiplied by 1.8).

- ▲ When playing a Ranked Battle match, in addition to the benefits it previously provided, Last-Ditch Effort's benefits will improve when the opposing team's counter is 50 or below, and continue to improve gradually as the counter continues to decrease.
This benefit will max out once the counter has reached 30.
There are no changes to the benefits this gear ability provides in Turf War matches.

Last-Ditch Effort returns in Splatoon 3, initially with no changes. In version 5.0.0, its maximum effectiveness was reduced from 24 AP to 18 AP.

Last-Ditch Effort grants its user 1 to 18 ability points each of the following abilities:

- Ink Saver (Main)

- Ink Saver (Sub)

- Ink Recovery Up

The activation conditions remain unchanged from Splatoon 2:

- There are at most 30 seconds remaining on the game clock, or Overtime has begun in a Ranked Battle, at which the maximum 18 ability points will be granted for each of the above abilities.

- In a Ranked Battle, the opposing team's countdown has at most 50 points remaining. The effects of Last-Ditch Effort increase as the opposing team's countdown decreases from 50 to 30 points remaining, starting with 1 ability point for each ability and maxing out to 18 ability points[3]:
